results.content: This was an excellent course.  Concise yet thorough.  Quick yet slow enough with terrific explanations.  I will be taking more courses from Telmo in the future.
results.content_html: This was an excellent course. Concise yet thorough. Quick yet slow enough with terrific explanations. I will be taking more courses from Telmo in the future.

results.content:
I did enjoy the course, I am curious as to why when after the login form that I get to where would be the project file (in my case 'lobby'(so when I had that working I can have user logged in to select a chatroom)), but would load that however with the 'auth/login' still parsed in the url-field. Similar as to when registering it would reload the page with the prompted message that user is registered but you could tell that something is off with the styling as if its loading the page you say but without the css. It's not about the colors, thats not the issue. It's the fact that when a stylesheet is set and it only loads if you manually type the route that tells me something is wrong. Another thing is that I had to remove the return next() methods so that the app worked but still I might have to rewatch this.

I wanted to build a cool chat application and wanted to refresh what I learned in a coding bootcamp with node and mysql (I gravitated towards mongo, and felt It was vital to do SQL with node). I pay close attention to detail and was wondering how also you make sure the cookies are secure also.
results.content_html:

Similar as to when registering it would reload the page with the prompted message that user is registered but you could tell that something is off with the styling as if its loading the page you say but without the css. It's not about the colors, thats not the issue. It's the fact that when a stylesheet is set and it only loads if you manually type the route that tells me something is wrong. Another thing is that I had to remove the return next() methods so that the app worked but still I might have to rewatch this.
